meanings.definition: Full of high-spirited gaiety; jovial or cheerful.
meanings.sent1: The children at the party were the merriest bunch, laughing and playing joyfully.
meanings.sent2: During the holidays, the merriest decorations adorned the streets, spreading happiness.
meanings.sent3: The merriest puppy in the litter wagged its tail with pure delight.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, the merriest sound in the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The merriest song filled the air, lifting everyone's spirits.

meanings.definition: Showing high spirits; lively and cheerful.
meanings.sent1: The merriest group of friends danced happily under the stars.
meanings.sent2: The merriest smile lit up her face as she shared the good news.
meanings.sent3: The merriest squirrel in the park chattered excitedly about its latest discovery.
meanings.sent4: His eyes sparkled with the merriest twinkle, reflecting his inner joy.
meanings.sent5: The merriest laughter filled the room, contagious and heartwarming.

meanings.sent1: At the festival, she was crowned the merriest of all, spreading happiness wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The merriest of the group always knew how to lift everyone's spirits with a joke.
meanings.sent3: The merriest in the family, he brought laughter and joy to every gathering.
meanings.sent4: In the land of merriment, she was known as the merriest, always celebrating life.
meanings.sent5: His title as the merriest was well-deserved, as his laughter was infectious.
